 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבַל‎</span> **verb** ==be senseless, foolish== (Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְבָלָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַבְלוּת‎</span> of immodesty; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> = (per contra) ***be noble, distinguished***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> also ***be gracious*** ([[BDB#Frey|Frey]]); Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְבַל‎</span> Pa\`el ***reject, despise***, see [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] [[Neh.3.6|Neh 3:6]]; [[Jer.14.21|Jer 14:21]] in derivatives as Late Hebrew); — 

**Qal** = ***be foolish*** [[Prov.30.32|Prov 30:32]] is doubted by Frankenb Toy (where see various renderings), and others, who think text corrupt. ***Perfect*** 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבַלְתָּ‎</span> [[Prov.30.32|Prov 30:32]] ***if thou hast been foolish*** in lifting up thyself (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎זַמּוֺתָ‎</span>). **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** 1 singular suffix consecutive <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְנִבַּלְתִּיךְ‎</span> [[Nah.3.6|Nah 3:6]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְנַבֵּל‎</span> [[Deut.32.15|Deut 32:15]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּנַבֵּל‎</span> [[Jer.14.21|Jer 14:21]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִנַבֵּל‎</span> [[Mic.7.6|Mic 7:6]] — ***regard*** or ***treat as a*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבָל‎</span> (q. v.), i.e. ***with contumely***, with accusative: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בֵּן מְנַבֵּל אָב‎</span> [[Mic.7.6|Mic 7:6]] ***son treateth father as a fool*** (with contumely); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְנ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צוּר‎</span> [[Deut.32.15|Deut 32:15]] ***and he treated with contumely the Rock*** of his salvation (i.e. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נטשִׁ‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> subject, [[Nah.3.6|Nah 3:6]] ***I will treat thee*** (Nineveh) ***with contumely*** (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִשְׂלַכְתִּ֫י צָלַיִךְ שִׁקֻּצִים‎</span>); [[Jer.14.21|Jer 14:21]] do not ***treat with contumely*** the throne of thy glory (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נאץ‎</span>). 



 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבֵל‎</span> **verb** ==sink or drop down, languish, wither and fall, fade== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***nabâlu***</u></abbr>, ***destroy***, [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>HWB 443 f.</sup> Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> v, VIII. ***die***; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְבֵילָא‎</span> ***corpse***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Isa.40.7|Isa 40:7]]; [[Isa.40.8|Isa 40:8]]; [[Jer.8.13|Jer 8:13]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָָֽבְלָה‎</span> [[Isa.24.4|Isa 24:4]] (twice in verse); ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִבּוֺל‎</span> [[Ps.1.3|Ps 1:3]] + 4 t. (on form compare [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:43»§ 43</sup>, 3, R, 1, h [[BDB#Ol|Ol]]<sup>§ 246 e</sup>) 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּבֹּל‎</span> [[Exod.18.18|Exod 18:18]] 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִבֹּלוּ‎</span> [[2Sam.22.46|2Sam 22:46]] = [[Ps.18.46|Ps 18:46]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִבּוֺל֑וּן‎</span> [[Ps.37.2|Ps 37:2]] 1 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַנָּ֫בֶל‎</span> [[Isa.64.5|Isa 64:5]] (on form compare [[BDB#Di|Di]] and [[BDB#Ol|Ol]]<sup>§ 236 e</sup>); ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבֹל‎</span> [[Exod.18.18|Exod 18:18]] construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְבֹל‎</span> [[Isa.34.4|Isa 34:4]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֹבֵל‎</span> [[Isa.28.1|Isa 28:1]]; [[Isa.28.4|Isa 28:4]] feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֹבֶ֫לָת‎</span> absolute [[Isa.34.4|Isa 34:4]] construct [[Isa.1.30|Isa 1:30]] — 

**1.** ***sink or drop down***, from exhaustion <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבֹל תִּכֹּל‎</span> [[Exod.18.18|Exod 18:18]] (Moses and Israel); from discouragement [[2Sam.22.46|2Sam 22:46]] = [[Ps.18.46|Ps 18:46]] (of foreigners, foes of Israel); of mountain <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַרנֹֿפֵל יִבּוֺל‎</span> [[Job.14.18|Job 14:18]] (but <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָפוֺל יִפּוֺל‎</span> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>Proph. Chald.</sup> [[BDB#Siegf|Siegf]] [[BDB#Baer|Baer]], after [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]], so [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] [or <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִבְלֶה‎</span>]; [[BDB#Du|Du]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבוֺל יִכּוֺל‎</span>). 

**2.** usually ***fall*** like a leaf, or flower ***wither and fall, fade:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּאֵלָה נֹבֶ֫לֶת עֶָלהָ‎</span> [[Isa.1.30|Isa 1:30]] ***like an oak falling as to it leaves*** (simile of people of Jerusalem); the host of heaven <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִבּוֺל כִּנְבֹל עָלֶה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מגֶּפֶן וּכְנֹבֶלֶת מִתְּאֵנָה‎</span> [[Isa.34.4|Isa 34:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עָלֵהוּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא יִבּ‎</span> [[Ezek.47.12|Ezek 47:12]] (trees in Ezekiel's vision), so figurative of good man [[Ps.1.3|Ps 1:3]] of Israel [[Jer.8.13|Jer 8:13]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַנָּ֫בֶל כֶּעָלֶה‎</span> [[Isa.64.5|Isa 64:5]] also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָבֵל צִיץ‎</span> [[Isa.40.7|Isa 40:7]]; [[Isa.40.8|Isa 40:8]] (both \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָבֵשׁ חָצִיר‎</span>), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צִיץ נֹבֵל‎</span> [[Isa.28.1|Isa 28:1]] compare v[[Isa.28.4|Isa 28:4]] of wicked <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּיֶרֶק דֶּשֶׁא יִבּ‎</span> [[Ps.37.2|Ps 37:2]]: (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֶּחָצִיר יִמָּ֑לוּ‎</span>); of devastated earth <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָֽבְלָה נָָֽבְלָה הָאָרֶַץ אֻמְלְלָה נָָֽבְלָה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תֵּבֵ֑ל‎</span> [[Isa.24.4|Isa 24:4]].
